projects.spatial.kdpoint

Class KDPoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • projects.spatial.kdpoint.KDPoint

  • public class KDPoint
extends java.lang.Object

    KDPoint is a class that represents a k-dimensional point in Euclidean space, where k is a positive integer. It provides methods for initialization, copy construction, equality checks and distance calculations. The precision of KDPoints is double.

    YOU SHOULD ***NOT*** EDIT THIS CLASS! If you do, you risk not passing our tests!

    Author:
    Jason Filippou

      double[] coords

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      KDPoint()
      Default constructor initializes this as a 2D KDPoint describing the Cartesian origin.

      Initialize a KDPoint with some values.
      KDPoint(int k)
      Initialize a k-dimensional KDPoint at the origin of the axes.
      KDPoint(KDPoint p)
      Initialize a KDPoint based on an already existing KDPoint.

    • Field Detail

      • coords

        public double[] coords
        To make matters simple for client code, we will allow the KDPoint's coordinates to be publicly accessible. This makes KDPoints mutable, so deep copies will be required wherever we copy KDPoints.

    • Constructor Detail

      • KDPoint

        public KDPoint()
        Default constructor initializes this as a 2D KDPoint describing the Cartesian origin.

      • KDPoint

        public KDPoint(int k)
        Initialize a k-dimensional KDPoint at the origin of the axes.
        Parameters:
        k - The dimensionality of the KDPoint.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the provided dimensionality is < 1.

      • KDPoint

        public KDPoint(double... vals)
        Initialize a KDPoint with some values. Implicitly sets the KDPoint's dimensionality.
        Parameters:
        vals - The values with which to initialize the KDPoint.
        See Also:
        System.arraycopy(Object, int, Object, int, int)

      • KDPoint

        public KDPoint(KDPoint p)
        Initialize a KDPoint based on an already existing KDPoint. Since KDPoint is a mutable class, all new KDPoint instances should be created this copy-constructor!
        Parameters:
        p - The KDPoint on which we will base the creation of this.

    • Method Detail

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • distance

        public double distance(KDPoint p)
                throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Calculate the squared Euclidean distance between this and p.
        Parameters:
        p - The KDPoint to calculate the distance to.
        Returns:
        The squared Euclidean distance between the two KDPoints.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the dimensionality of the two KDPoints is different.

      • distance

        public static double distance(KDPoint p1,
                              KDPoint p2)
        A static version of distance calculations. Since the Squared Euclidean distance is symmetric, it's somewhat awkward to have to specify a start and end point, as distance does, so we provide this option as well.
        Parameters:
        p1 - One of the two KDPoints to calculate the distance of.
        p2 - One of the two KDPoints to calculate the distance of.
        Returns:
        The Euclidean distance between p1 and p2.
